info.description: Amazon MQ is a managed message broker service for Apache ActiveMQ that makes it easy to set up and operate message brokers in the cloud. A message broker allows software applications and components to communicate using various programming languages, operating systems, and formal messaging protocols.
info.title: AmazonMQ

get.description: Returns a list of all brokers.

BrokerSummaries.description: A list of information about all brokers.

items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the broker.

BrokerArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the broker.

BrokerId.description: The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the broker.

BrokerName.description: The name of the broker. This value must be unique in your AWS account, 1-50 characters long, must contain only letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores, and must not contain whitespaces, brackets, wildcard characters, or special characters.

Created.description: The time when the broker was created.

DeploymentMode.description: Required. The deployment mode of the broker.

NextToken.description: The token that specifies the next page of results Amazon MQ should return. To request the first page, leave nextToken empty.

post.description: Creates a broker. Note: This API is asynchronous.

BrokerArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the broker.

BrokerId.description: The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the broker.

schema.description: Creates a broker using the specified properties.

AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.description: Required. Enables automatic upgrades to new minor versions for brokers, as Apache releases the versions. The automatic upgrades occur during the maintenance window of the broker or after a manual broker reboot.

BrokerName.description: Required. The name of the broker. This value must be unique in your AWS account, 1-50 characters long, must contain only letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores, and must not contain whitespaces, brackets, wildcard characters, or special characters.

Configuration.description: A list of information about the configuration.

Id.description: Required. The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the configuration.

Revision.description: The revision number of the configuration.

CreatorRequestId.description: The unique ID that the requester receives for the created broker. Amazon MQ passes your ID with the API action. Note: We recommend using a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) for the creatorRequestId. You may omit the creatorRequestId if your application doesn't require idempotency.

DeploymentMode.description: Required. The deployment mode of the broker.

EngineType.description: Required. The type of broker engine. Note: Currently, Amazon MQ supports only ACTIVEMQ.

EngineVersion.description: Required. The version of the broker engine. For a list of supported engine versions, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazon-mq/latest/developer-guide/broker-engine.html

Logs.description: Enables Amazon CloudWatch logging for brokers.

Audit.description: Enables audit logging. Every user management action made using JMX or the ActiveMQ Web Console is logged.

MaintenanceWindowStartTime.description: The parameters that determine the WeeklyStartTime.

DayOfWeek.description: Required. The day of the week.

TimeZone.description: The time zone, UTC by default, in either the Country/City format, or the UTC offset format.

PubliclyAccessible.description: Required. Enables connections from applications outside of the VPC that hosts the broker's subnets.

SecurityGroups.description: The list of rules (1 minimum, 125 maximum) that authorize connections to brokers.

SubnetIds.description: The list of groups (2 maximum) that define which subnets and IP ranges the broker can use from different Availability Zones. A SINGLE_INSTANCE deployment requires one subnet (for example, the default subnet). An ACTIVE_STANDBY_MULTI_AZ deployment requires two subnets.

Tags.description: Create tags when creating the broker.

Users.description: Required. The list of ActiveMQ users (persons or applications) who can access queues and topics. This value can contain only alphanumeric characters, dashes, periods, underscores, and tildes (- . _ ~). This value must be 2-100 characters long.

items.description: An ActiveMQ user associated with the broker.

ConsoleAccess.description: Enables access to the the ActiveMQ Web Console for the ActiveMQ user.

Groups.description: The list of groups (20 maximum) to which the ActiveMQ user belongs. This value can contain only alphanumeric characters, dashes, periods, underscores, and tildes (- . _ ~). This value must be 2-100 characters long.

Password.description: Required. The password of the ActiveMQ user. This value must be at least 12 characters long, must contain at least 4 unique characters, and must not contain commas.

Username.description: Required. The username of the ActiveMQ user. This value can contain only alphanumeric characters, dashes, periods, underscores, and tildes (- . _ ~). This value must be 2-100 characters long.

delete.description: Deletes a broker. Note: This API is asynchronous.

BrokerId.description: The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the broker.

get.description: Returns information about the specified broker.

AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.description: Required. Enables automatic upgrades to new minor versions for brokers, as Apache releases the versions. The automatic upgrades occur during the maintenance window of the broker or after a manual broker reboot.

BrokerArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the broker.

BrokerId.description: The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the broker.

BrokerInstances.description: A list of information about allocated brokers.

ConsoleURL.description: The URL of the broker's ActiveMQ Web Console.

IpAddress.description: The IP address of the Elastic Network Interface (ENI) attached to the broker.

PendingChange.description: The type of change pending for the ActiveMQ user.

BrokerId.description: Required. The unique ID that Amazon MQ generates for the broker.

NextToken.description: The token that specifies the next page of results Amazon MQ should return. To request the first page, leave nextToken empty.

Users.description: Required. The list of all ActiveMQ usernames for the specified broker.

get.description: Returns a list of all configurations.

items.description: Returns information about all configurations.

Arn.description: Required. The ARN of the configuration.

Created.description: Required. The date and time of the configuration revision.

Description.description: Required. The description of the configuration.

EngineType.description: Required. The type of broker engine. Note: Currently, Amazon MQ supports only ACTIVEMQ.

EngineVersion.description: Required. The version of the broker engine. For a list of supported engine versions, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazon-mq/latest/developer-guide/broker-engine.html

LatestRevision.description: Required. The latest revision of the configuration.

Revision.description: Required. The revision number of the configuration.

Name.description: Required. The name of the configuration. This value can contain only alphanumeric characters, dashes, periods, underscores, and tildes (- . _ ~). This value must be 1-150 characters long.

Tags.description: The list of all tags associated with this configuration.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of configurations that Amazon MQ can return per page (20 by default). This value must be an integer from 5 to 100.

NextToken.description: The token that specifies the next page of results Amazon MQ should return. To request the first page, leave nextToken empty.

SubnetIds.description: The list of groups (2 maximum) that define which subnets and IP ranges the broker can use from different Availability Zones. A SINGLE_INSTANCE deployment requires one subnet (for example, the default subnet). An ACTIVE_STANDBY_MULTI_AZ deployment requires two subnets.
